replies.msg:
Real Madrid & Juventus in talks to sign Paul Pogba

Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba wants to leave the Premier League club with Real Madrid and Juventus interested in signing the Frenchman, according to Sky Germany.

Both clubs are already holding talks with Pogba’s agent, Mino Raiola, with a transfer away from Old Trafford in the summer very likely, per Sky’s report.

Sky Germany correspondent Max Bielefeld said: “We know that Paul Pogba’s contract with Manchester United is no longer being renewed. The likelihood of a change in the summer is very high.”

More follows.

Alvaro Odriozola on joining FC Bayern:

- "It is a great honor to play for such a big club"
- "I grew up watching this club winning trophies"
- "Wearing this shirt is a great honor for me"
- "When you receive a call from Bayern you can't say 'no'
- "I am ready to help my team"

Despite signing Álvaro Odriozola on loan, Bayern are still thinking about the future and are willing to make a 'big offer' for Achraf Hakimi. Bayern have not given up on Hakimi who still has doubts over his future as he would have Carvajal ahead of him in Madrid [@jfelixdiaz]

Jesús Vallejo joins Granada CF on loan from Wolves

Jesús Vallejo will spend the remainder of the season at Granada CF, joining on loan from Wolverhampton Wanderers, according to freelance journalist Arancha Rodríguez.

The Real Madrid loanee has featured just seven times for the Premier League side and will bolster Diego Martínez’s defence.

“I’m going to be clear, Jesus is probably going because he wants to play,” said Wolves and former Valencia coach Nuno Espírito Santo.

https://getfootballnewsspain.com/jesus-vallejo-joins-granada-cf-on-loan-from-wolves/

Real Madrid close in on deal for Malaga youngster Hugo Vallejo

Malaga's talented left winger Hugo Vallejo is close to becoming a Real Madrid player as all three parties have already agreed terms for his move to the Estadio Santiago Bernabeu.

Pending the final thumbs up from the Andalusians' president Abdullah Al Thani, Los Blancos will pay 300,000 euros, plus one million euros in a bonus in the event the 19-year-old plays 10 games with the seniors.
